description:
Fragments II
frag•ment [ n. (frăg′mənt) ]
a part broken off or detached
an isolated, unfinished, or incomplete part
an odd piece, bit, or scrap.
Two more women offer their flesh for money. They are put to the grind, bound and tormented with instruments of pleasure and pain.
Sometimes pressure holds things together and other times it breaks things apart.
title: Fragments II
